column5: The MSc Cancer Care is a programme produced and delivered by the Clatterbridge Cancer Centre, Liverpool and University of Liverpool.INTRODUCTIONThis course is a three year part-time programme developed to allow care professionals to continue working in their NHS role alongside their studies. This programme will enable you to enhance your professional development as a registered care professional and deepen your knowledge of the subject.You will explore the broad impact of a cancer diagnosis and the patient’s and their family’s journey. By the end of the course you will have an awareness of the individual’s needs and a comprehensive approach to care.
column7: UK fees (applies to Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland) Part-time place, per year - £3,467  International fees This course is not available to international students.
